title: AMD stock named Morgan Stanley's top chip pick, but not out of 'enthusiasm'; Lam Research was Morgan Stanley's prior top pick, but that stock has enjoyed a sharp recent rally
text:
AMD "remains the worst performing stock in large cap despite the fact that their server roadmap demonstrably improved its technology leadership position over the course of the year," Moore wrote.

Conversely, Lam's stock had rocketed almost 50% in the eight weeks since the company's earnings report, as of the publication of Moore's note, despite a weakening spending outlook.

"Lam remains [overweight] and is our preferred stock in semicaps, and we definitely think that some relative rerating was in order, but the magnitude of the rally saps our enthusiasm somewhat," he said.

As for AMD, Moore notes that the company "still has some risk" from fourth-quarter cuts to cloud capital expenditures, but he also sees some encouraging trends ahead. For one, AMD is poised to once again pick up server market share during 2023.

Read: Why Nvidia is this analyst's top stock pick for 2023

AMD isn't immune to a more sluggish backdrop for capex growth, but Moore said that the most important thing for names in the server central processing unit (CPU) business is "relative execution on processor architecture."

See also: AMD, Nike, Zillow among UBS stock picks with the 'highest conviction' for 2023

AMD "demonstrably executed on the 4th Gen EPYC product cycle," he said, while Intel Corp.'s INTC "Sapphire Rapids is yet to commercially launch." That dynamic "should underpin strong relative growth" for AMD in 2023, he reasoned.

Despite the new designation at Morgan Stanley, AMD shares are off 3% in midday trading Thursday. The stock has fallen by more than half over the course of the year, as the S&P 500 SPX has slid 18%.

AMD stock named Morgan Stanley's top chip pick, but not out of 'enthusiasm'
